title.native: 遊☆戯☆王デュエルモンスターズＧＸ

description:
Duel Academy, one of the most prestigious schools in Duel Monsters history. There, students learn the fundamentals of becoming not just duelists, but large business owners.

Judai Yuki is a new student with only one thing on his mind: to become the next King of Games. Judai meets several friends, teachers, and even enemies at the large Dueling school. There, he'll have to face off against several different dorms—Slifer Red, Ra Yellow, and Obelisk Blue—to become the number one duelist. Will Judai be able to pass all of them?

Based on Kazuki Takahashi's world-famous anime and manga, <cite>Yu-Gi-Oh!</cite>.

tags.name: Card Battle
tags.description: Centers around individuals competing in card games.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

node.description:
The creator of Yu-Gi-Oh! He loved playing shogi, mahjong, card games, and tabletop role-playing games.

In an interview with Shonen Jump, Takahashi stated that his favorite manga from other authors included Akira by Katsuhiro Otomo, JoJo's Bizarre Adventure by Hirohiko Araki, and Dragon Ball by Akira Toriyama. He also enjoyed reading American comics, with Hellboy being his favorite American comic book character.

On July 6, 2022, a body in snorkeling gear was found off the coast of Nago City, Okinawa, which was identified the following day as Takahashi. It was revealed by a U.S. Army Officer that Takahashi attempted to aid in the rescue of three people at a riptide in Mermaid's Grotto, Onna, on July 4, 2022.

JAM Project ("JAM" standing for "Japan Animationsong Makers") is an anime music genre (or anison) "supergroup" based in Japan, originally founded on July 19, 2000 by famous 1970s theme song artist Ichirou Mizuki. The group is composed of many vocal artists well known in the genre; aside from the many anime and video game theme songs that this group has performed together, each member is famous for their own solo performances of anime-related music.  As a group, they are perhaps best known for their themes for the Super Robot Wars series of video games.
Israeli dubber, singer, musician and director. preformed with the band Asaf Avidan & The Mojos until 2011. Now performs solo and released an album called Different Pulses.

[Website](http://psychiclover.net)

Psychic Lover (サイキックラバー) is a J-pop band consisting of vocalist YOFFY (Yoshiyuki Wada / 和田よしゆき) and guitarist [IMAJO](https://anilist.co/staff/357213) (Tatsuhiro Imajo / 今城龍寛). Originally consisting of six members, YOFFY and IMAJO are the only two who remained for their rise to fame. Much of their work has been featured as opening and closing themes of Japanese television series and anime. YOFFY has also worked with Eizo Sakamoto (vocalist of [Anthem](https://anilist.co/staff/191547/) and Animetal), [Masaaki Endou](https://anilist.co/staff/101528/), [Sakura Nogawa](https://anilist.co/staff/95204/), [Ai Tokunaga](https://anilist.co/staff/95324), [Ryouko Shintani](https://anilist.co/staff/95315/), [Mayumi Gojou](https://anilist.co/staff/107007/), [Sister MAYO](https://anilist.co/staff/345387/), and [Yukari Fukui](https://anilist.co/staff/95359/) on other projects.

[Official Website ](http://kitadani-hiroshi.com/)

In November 1994 he officially started his career in a trio called [STRAGGER]. In July 1998, he released a solo album and an year later, in November 1999, the opening song "We Are!" for the One Piece anime marked his debut as an anison singer. Shortly after, at the end of 1999, he joined the Lapis Lazuli band.  In August 2002 he become a regular member in [JAM Project (Japanese Animationsong Makers)](https://anilist.co/staff/102041/JAM-Project) where he is active even today.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋ナツコ)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/193091/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1314120680091209728)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/154741/)._

Giorgio Vincenzo Vanni is an Italian singer and song-writer.  Vanni is well known for performing theme songs of Italian dubs of Japanese and American animated TV series.   The dubbed Italian songs he sings usually are not covers of the Japanese songs but tend to be newly written songs for the Italian dub of the anime.   (Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](https://twitter.com/LoveLoveDragon) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LoveLoveDragon) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/masamiokui/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/okui-masami/)

Masami Okui is a J-Rock/J-Pop singer who was born in Itami, Hyōgo Prefecture. She began her professional musical career at age 21 as a concert backup singer.

From almost the very beginning of her career, Masami has sung themes for anime tv and movies. She is especially well known for her songs from Revolutionary Girl Utena, Slayers, Sorcerer Hunters, Di Gi Charat, Magic User's Club, Jungle de Ikou, Akihabara Dennou Gumi, Ray the Animation, He Is My Master and Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters. She has performed material for more than 50 singles and 20 albums to date (including her work with JAM Project and Chihiro Yonekura).
